intro: Mirabilis bracteosa var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered four o'clock, is a species of flowering plant in the family Nyctaginaceae. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that open in the late afternoon and close at dawn. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
